query: How hot should the oil be in the wok?
text: Relevant Information: wok Information Type: equipment Instruction: Heat oil in a wok to 350°F Step: 1. Heat oil in a wok to 350°F. Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Add water and vodka and whisk until a smooth batter is formed, adding up to 2 tablespoons additional water if batter is too thick. It should have the consistency of thin paint and fall off of the whisk in thin ribbons that instantly disappear as they hit the surface of the batter in the bowl.

Add remaining fish sauce and soy sauce and mash in mortar to form a sauce. what kind of sauce do I mix with the fish sauce? soy What is the next step after grinding the chilies, garlic, palm sugar, fish sauce and soy sauce into a paste? Finely slice remaining garlic and chilies and combine with shallot and lime leaves in a small bowl. what do I finely slice? garlic what do I combine the garlic chili and lime leaves with? shallot How should I cook the beef in this step? Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of beef and cook, without moving, until well seared, about 1 minute. Continue cooking, while stirring and tossing, until beef is lightly cooked but still pink in spots, about 1 minute. Repeat with 1 more tablespoon oil and remaining beef. How is searing the beef done in this step? Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of beef and cook, without moving, until well seared, about 1 minute. After searing the beef, what should I do next? Continue cooking, while stirring and tossing, until beef is lightly cooked but still pink in spots, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. what do i add once the wok is smoking? half of beef what do I do over the high heat? reheat wok How should I manage the heat when reheating the wok? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: beef Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Reheat wok over high heat and add all of the beef, along with sliced garlic/chili/makrut lime mixture. Step: 4. Reheat wok over high heat and add all of the beef, along with sliced garlic/chili/makrut lime mixture. Continue to cook, tossing and stirring constantly, until stir-fry is aromatic and shallots have completely softened, about 1 minute.

answer: Continue to cook, tossing and stirring constantly, until stir-fry is aromatic and shallots have completely softened

query: What should I do if I am using lightly stale bread for this recipe?
text: Relevant Information: food processor bowl Information Type: equipment Instruction: Transfer bread to food processor bowl (set aside but don't clean rimmed baking sheet), and pulse until reduced to small crumbs, taking care not to over-process into a fine powder, 8 to 10 pulses. Step: 1. For the Toasted Breadcrumbs: If using fresh or lightly stale bread, adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). (If using fully stale and dried bread, skip baking step.) Arrange bread in single layer on rimmed baking sheet and bake until completely dried, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes. Transfer bread to food processor bowl (set aside but don't clean rimmed baking sheet), and pulse until reduced to small crumbs, taking care not to over-process into a fine powder, 8 to 10 pulses.

query: What should I do if I am using lightly stale bread for this recipe? Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). what do I need to use to toast the bread crumbs?
text: Relevant Information: 165°C Information Type: temperature Instruction: For the Toasted Breadcrumbs: If using fresh or lightly stale bread, adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Step: 1. For the Toasted Breadcrumbs: If using fresh or lightly stale bread, adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). (If using fully stale and dried bread, skip baking step.) Arrange bread in single layer on rimmed baking sheet and bake until completely dried, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes. Transfer bread to food processor bowl (set aside but don't clean rimmed baking sheet), and pulse until reduced to small crumbs, taking care not to over-process into a fine powder, 8 to 10 pulses.

query: What should I do if I am using lightly stale bread for this recipe? Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). what do I need to use to toast the bread crumbs? oven how long do I need to leave bread crumbs to cool once I have taken them out of the oven?
text: Relevant Information: oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes. Step: 1. For the Toasted Breadcrumbs: If using fresh or lightly stale bread, adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). (If using fully stale and dried bread, skip baking step.) Arrange bread in single layer on rimmed baking sheet and bake until completely dried, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes. Transfer bread to food processor bowl (set aside but don't clean rimmed baking sheet), and pulse until reduced to small crumbs, taking care not to over-process into a fine powder, 8 to 10 pulses.

text: Relevant Information: small crumbs Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Transfer bread to food processor bowl (set aside but don't clean rimmed baking sheet), and pulse until reduced to small crumbs, taking care not to over-process into a fine powder, 8 to 10 pulses. Once cool, set aside 1/2 cup (60g) toasted breadcrumbs for the pasta, and transfer remaining crumbs to an airtight container for future use; the extra breadcrumbs can be stored at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.

query: what do I need to do with the oil in the wok?
text: Relevant Information: wok Information Type: equipment Instruction: Heat oil in a wok to 350°F Step: 1. Heat oil in a wok to 350°F. Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Add water and vodka and whisk until a smooth batter is formed, adding up to 2 tablespoons additional water if batter is too thick. It should have the consistency of thin paint and fall off of the whisk in thin ribbons that instantly disappear as they hit the surface of the batter in the bowl.

query: what do I need to do with the oil in the wok? heat what else do I add with the cornstarch, baking powder and salt?
text: Relevant Information: cup Information Type: equipment Instruction: . Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Step: 1. Heat oil in a wok to 350°F. Add water and vodka and whisk until a smooth batter is formed, adding up to 2 tablespoons additional water if batter is too thick. text: Relevant Information: wok Information Type: equipment Instruction: Clear a space in the center of the wok and add the scallion/ginger/garlic mixture. Step: 5. Return infused oil to the wok and heat over high heat until lightly smoking. Add leeks, celery, and long pepper and cook, stirring and tossing, until vegetables are lightly charred and tender-crisp, about 1 1/2 minutes. Clear a space in the center of the wok and add the scallion/ginger/garlic mixture. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add peanuts, dried chilies, and drained tofu. Stir sauce mixture and add to wok. Cook, tossing and folding ingredients together until tofu is fully coated. Add scallion greens and ground peppercorns and toss to combine. Serve immediately with white rice.

query: what do I need to do with the oil in the wok? heat what else do I add with the cornstarch, baking powder and salt? flour what should I use to mix the cornstarch flour baking powder and salt?
text: Relevant Information: 1/2 cup flour Information Type: ingredient Instruction: . Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Step: 1. Heat oil in a wok to 350°F. Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Add water and vodka and whisk until a smooth batter is formed, adding up to 2 tablespoons additional water if batter is too thick. It should have the consistency of thin paint and fall off of the whisk in thin ribbons that instantly disappear as they hit the surface of the batter in the bowl.

query: What should I use to make the blackberry purée?
text: Relevant Information: blender Information Type: equipment Instruction: To Prepare: Using a blender, food processor, or immersion blender, purée blackberries until totally smooth. Step: 1. To Prepare: Using a blender, food processor, or immersion blender, purée blackberries until totally smooth. If seeds bother you, the purée can be strained using a fine-mesh sieve; if you do plan to strain, add a couple extra blackberries to make up for the loss. Measure out exactly 6 ounces fresh blackberry purée (about 3/4 cup; 170g) and bring to about 70°F (21°C) before using.

Lightly grease an 8- by 2-inch or 8- by 3-inch anodized aluminum cake pan and line with parchment what can I use instead of sugar? sugar is soft butter better? butter what can I use instead of salt? salt When should I add the egg whites? With mixer still running, add egg whites a little at a time, letting each addition fully incorporate before proceeding to the next. How can I incorporate egg whites evenly into the mix? With mixer still running, add egg whites a little at a time, letting each addition fully incorporate before proceeding to the next. what alternative to flour can I use? flour could I use jam? prepared blackberry What does one do after adding in the first third of the blackberry purée? Repeat with remaining flour and fruit, working in thirds as before. could I use coconut flour? flour what could I use instead of a beater? beater how do I scrape the bowl? scrape bowl What's next? The batter should look bright purple and register between 65 and 68°F (18 and 20°C) on a digital thermometer. could I use another temperature? 68°f How can I stop textural problems from being created in the cake? (Significant deviation indicates ingredients were too warm or too cold, which can lead to textural problems with the cake.) What should I do if the batter looks streaky or tie-dyed? gently fold with a flexible spatula until streaks disappear. could I put it in the refrigerator for 1 hour? for 1 hour What should I do after the cake has baked for about 30 minutes? Cool directly in pan for 1 hour, then run a butter knife around the edges to loosen. could I use soya cheese? cheese could I use clotted cream? cream How should I serve the cake after it is fully cooled? Top with a batch of Cream Cheese Frosting and a handful of fresh blackberries and cut with a chef's knife to serve. How can I preserve the cake if I don't want to serve it immediately?
text: Relevant Information: knife Information Type: equipment Instruction: Top with a batch of Cream Cheese Frosting and a handful of fresh blackberries and cut with a chef's knife to serve. Step: 6. Scrape into prepared pan, spread into an even layer, and bake until puffed and firm, about 30 minutes. Cool directly in pan for 1 hour, then run a butter knife around the edges to loosen. Invert onto a wire rack, peel off parchment, and place on a serving plate until fully cool, about 1 hour. Top with a batch of Cream Cheese Frosting and a handful of fresh blackberries and cut with a chef's knife to serve. Wrapped in plastic, this cake will keep for up to 3 days at cool room temperature.

query: What should I use to make the blackberry purée? Using a blender, food processor, or immersion blender what is 70 degrees Fahrenheit in Centigrade for my oven? 21°c how many fresh blackberries do I need?
text: Relevant Information: 21°C Information Type: temperature Instruction: Measure out exactly 6 ounces fresh blackberry purée (about 3/4 cup; 170g) and bring to about 70°F (21°C) before using. Step: 1. To Prepare: Using a blender, food processor, or immersion blender, purée blackberries until totally smooth. text: Relevant Information: wok Information Type: equipment Instruction: When ready to cook, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Step: 3. query: How should I prepare the potato before cooking it in the microwave or oven?
text: Relevant Information: 425°F oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Alternatively, place potato in 425°F oven and cook until a paring knife can be inserted in middle of potato with no resistance, about 1 hour. Step: 1. Using the tines of a fork, poke holes in potato all over. Place potato on a plate and microwave on high until a paring knife can be inserted in middle of potato with no resistance, 9 to 12 minutes, checking and flipping the potato every 3 minutes. Alternatively, place potato in 425°F oven and cook until a paring knife can be inserted in middle of potato with no resistance, about 1 hour. Split potato open and allow to cool slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Using a spoon, scoop out flesh in a small bowl, discard skin.

Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat until shimmering. Working in batches, add short ribs and brown on all sides, about 4 minutes per side. How should I prepare the celery, carrot, onion, and garlic? Cook, stirring, until browned, about 6 minutes. What should I do if the contents of the pot start to burn? Lower heat at any point if the contents of the pot threaten to burn. what kind of paste do we add to the vegetables after cooking them for 6 minutes? tomato what step do we take if the contents of the pot begin to burn? lower heat what kind of wine do we add to the pot? red wine What exactly should I do after adding the stock? If using store-bought stock, place it in a large bowl first and sprinkle all over with gelatin until bloomed, then add to Dutch oven. What does it mean to bloom gelatin on the stock? Place it in a large bowl first and sprinkle all over with gelatin until bloomed. What herbs should I add in this recipe step? Add thyme and bay leaves. What do I need to do with the port? bring port to a very gentle simmer, regulating heat to maintain that simmer. Cook, uncovered, and reduce until syrupy, about 1 hour; should yield about 1/2 cup (120ml) in volume. How do I handle the short ribs once they're done cooking? Carefully remove short ribs from pot and transfer to a clean platter (they will be very tender, so the bones may slip out; try to hold them together as you transfer them). What do I do after the short ribs are removed from the pot? Transfer them to a clean platter and tent with foil. What happens after the short ribs are put on a platter? Tent them with foil. What should I do with the fat that accumulated on the braising liquid? Skim accumulated fat from surface of braising liquid and discard. How should I handle the braising liquid after skimming off the fat? Strain braising liquid through a fine-mesh strainer set over a large heatproof bowl, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. How do I properly strain the braising liquid? Strain braising liquid through a fine-mesh strainer set over a large heatproof bowl, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. What is the process after returning the strained braising liquid to the Dutch oven? Return to heat and bring to a gentle simmer, adjusting heat to maintain simmer. Simmer until braising liquid is reduced to 2 cups, about 1 hour; skim any foam that accumulates on the surface as needed. What do I do if foam accumulates on the surface of the simmering liquid?
text: Relevant Information: about 1 hour Information Type: time Instruction: Simmer until braising liquid is reduced to 2 cups, about 1 hour; skim any foam that accumulates on the surface as needed. Step: 8. Rinse out Dutch oven, then return strained braising liquid to it. Return to heat and bring to a gentle simmer, adjusting heat to maintain simmer. Simmer until braising liquid is reduced to 2 cups, about 1 hour; skim any foam that accumulates on the surface as needed. Add port wine reduction to braising liquid.

Cook, uncovered, and reduce until syrupy, about 1 hour; should yield about 1/2 cup (120ml) in volume. How do I handle the short ribs once they're done cooking? Carefully remove short ribs from pot and transfer to a clean platter (they will be very tender, so the bones may slip out; try to hold them together as you transfer them). What do I do after the short ribs are removed from the pot? Transfer them to a clean platter and tent with foil. What happens after the short ribs are put on a platter? Tent them with foil. What should I do with the fat that accumulated on the braising liquid? Skim accumulated fat from surface of braising liquid and discard. How should I handle the braising liquid after skimming off the fat? Strain braising liquid through a fine-mesh strainer set over a large heatproof bowl, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. How do I properly strain the braising liquid? Strain braising liquid through a fine-mesh strainer set over a large heatproof bowl, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. What is the process after returning the strained braising liquid to the Dutch oven? Return to heat and bring to a gentle simmer, adjusting heat to maintain simmer. Simmer until braising liquid is reduced to 2 cups, about 1 hour; skim any foam that accumulates on the surface as needed. What do I do if foam accumulates on the surface of the simmering liquid? Skim any foam that accumulates on the surface as needed. How can I determine if the sauce has the right consistency? The sauce should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon and leave a trail when you drag your finger through it. How do I properly thicken the sauce using the cornstarch slurry? whisk in the cornstarch slurry and bring to a simmer until thickened slightly. What should I do if the sauce is still too thin? text: Relevant Information: 10 minutes Information Type: time Instruction: Turn off the oven, open the door, and let it stand ajar 10 minutes. Step: 8. Turn off the oven, open the door, and let it stand ajar 10 minutes. Close the door and set the oven to 250°F. Continue baking until the outer edge of the cheesecake feels firm, though the innermost ring of cheesecake will wobble quite freely if you shake the pan, about 35 minutes. Testing with a thermometer will not cause the cheesecake to crack; cracking is the result of over-baking and nothing more.

Continue baking until the outer edge of the cheesecake feels firm, though the innermost ring of cheesecake will wobble quite freely if you shake the pan, about 35 minutes. This wobbly zone should be no more than 3-inches across. The cheesecake will be done when the very center registers 145°F on a digital thermometer inserted to a depth of 2-inches. Testing with a thermometer will not cause the cheesecake to crack; cracking is the result of over-baking and nothing more.

text: Relevant Information: cheesecake Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Loose Bottom Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Step: 10. Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Loose Bottom Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Place the pan on a large can of tomatoes or a similarly sized object; something tall enough to lift the cheesecake 4-inches from the counter, and wide enough to form a stable base. With both hands on the sides of the pan, pull downward to drop the outer ring away from the bottom. Place the cake onto a flat work surface, loosen it from the bottom of the pan with an offset spatula, and transfer to a large, flat serving plate. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until needed, up to 10 days.

Add the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and salt to the pan, and stir with a fork until well combined. where should I add the salt? pan How do I get the crust to form at the bottom of the pan? With your fingers, compress into an even layer along the bottom of the pan. what other ingredient do I need besides cream cheese goat cheese lemon juice vanilla extract and salt? orange flower water what else what else should I add other than cream cheese goat cheese lemon juice vanilla extract and water? salt, and orange flower water Ok. I have done that. What is next? Do not add the sugar at this time. what method should I use to ensure there are no lumps of cheese? cream What is the first thing I should do in this step? Reduce speed to medium-low, add the sugar all at once, and mix only until well combined. what should I remove from the mixer? bowl what ingredients should I add next? eggs how should I mix the eggs? whisk How should I handle any clots of chalazae that remain trapped in the strainer? Discard any clots of chalazae that remain trapped in the strainer. where should I boil the cream? stainless steel pot what should I boil? cream What should I do after bringing the cream to a full boil? While mixing on low, add the hot cream all at once in a steady stream, and mix a few seconds more. what should be added to the mixture next? hot cream What do I do with the batter if I'm not using it immediately? Refrigerate the batter in an airtight container until needed, up to one week. Ok. what's next? Bring cold batter to room temperature before baking. What should I do after pouring batter into the pan? Place it on a baking sheet. what should I bounce on the surface to dislodge any air bubbles? spoon What strategy is suggested to remove air bubbles from the batter? Bounce a spoon across the surface to dislodge any air bubbles that may have slipped through. what temperature in fahrenheit do I need to bake it at? 250°f What is the alternate baking method mentioned for a denser, paler cheesecake? Skip to the next step and bake only at 250°F until done; this may take an hour or more. how long should I leave the oven door ajar? 10 minutes What is the next step after turning off the oven and leaving the door ajar for 10 minutes? Close the door and set the oven to 250°F. Continue baking until the outer edge of the cheesecake feels firm, though the innermost ring of cheesecake will wobble quite freely if you shake the pan, about 35 minutes. how long should I continue baking? about 35 minutes How can I tell when the cheesecake is done baking? The cheesecake will be done when the very center registers 145°F on a digital thermometer inserted to a depth of 2-inches. What causes the cheesecake to crack? Cracking is the result of over-baking and nothing more. what should I use to loosen the sides? thin knife What's the next step after letting the cheesecake cool for 15 minutes? Run a thin knife or offset spatula around the sides to loosen (this helps the cake settle evenly as it cools). After cooling the cheesecake, I've to let it settle evenly. What's the correct technique to do this? Run a thin knife or offset spatula around the sides to loosen (this helps the cake settle evenly as it cools). how long should I leave it cool at room temperature? 1 hour how long should I refrigerate? 12 hours How do I separate the cheesecake from a loose bottom cake pan?
text: Relevant Information: pan Information Type: equipment Instruction: Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Loose Bottom Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Step: 10. Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Loose Bottom Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Place the pan on a large can of tomatoes or a similarly sized object; something tall enough to lift the cheesecake 4-inches from the counter, and wide enough to form a stable base. With both hands on the sides of the pan, pull downward to drop the outer ring away from the bottom. Place the cake onto a flat work surface, loosen it from the bottom of the pan with an offset spatula, and transfer to a large, flat serving plate. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until needed, up to 10 days.

text: Relevant Information: pan Information Type: equipment Instruction: Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Traditional Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Step: 11. Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Traditional Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Stand the cake in a few inches of scalding hot water until the pan feels warm (a roasting pan works well for this). Drape the cake in plastic wrap to protect its surface, then invert onto a large, flat plate, and lift the pan to pull it away. It should slide free without any resistance; if not, continue standing in hot water a few minutes more. After removing the pan, peel the parchment from the crust, and re-invert the cheesecake onto a serving plate. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until needed, up to 10 days.

Run a thin knife or offset spatula around the sides to loosen (this helps the cake settle evenly as it cools). how long should I leave it cool at room temperature? 1 hour how long should I refrigerate? 12 hours How do I separate the cheesecake from a loose bottom cake pan? Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Place the pan on a large can of tomatoes or a similarly sized object; something tall enough to lift the cheesecake 4-inches from the counter, and wide enough to form a stable base. With both hands on the sides of the pan, pull downward to drop the outer ring away from the bottom. Place the cake onto a flat work surface, loosen it from the bottom of the pan with an offset spatula, and transfer to a large, flat serving plate. what should I use to loosen the cheesecake? thin knife what kind of can should I use to stand it on? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: pan Information Type: equipment Instruction: Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Traditional Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Step: 11. Unmolding the Cheesecake From a Traditional Cake Pan: Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Stand the cake in a few inches of scalding hot water until the pan feels warm (a roasting pan works well for this). Drape the cake in plastic wrap to protect its surface, then invert onto a large, flat plate, and lift the pan to pull it away. It should slide free without any resistance; if not, continue standing in hot water a few minutes more. After removing the pan, peel the parchment from the crust, and re-invert the cheesecake onto a serving plate. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until needed, up to 10 days.
answer: offset spatula

Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Stand the cake in a few inches of scalding hot water until the pan feels warm (a roasting pan works well for this). Drape the cake in plastic wrap to protect its surface, then invert onto a large, flat plate, and lift the pan to pull it away. It should slide free without any resistance; if not, continue standing in hot water a few minutes more. After removing the pan, peel the parchment from the crust, and re-invert the cheesecake onto a serving plate. what kind of pan works well?

text: Relevant Information: flexible spatula Information Type: equipment Instruction: To Serve: Combine the fresh fruit and warmed fruit syrup or jam in a large bowl, and gently fold with a flexible spatula until the fruit is well coated and glistening (optional). Step: 12. To Serve: Combine the fresh fruit and warmed fruit syrup or jam in a large bowl, and gently fold with a flexible spatula until the fruit is well coated and glistening (optional). Cut the cheesecake with a large chef's knife dipped in hot water; for clean and tidy portions of cheesecake, pause to clean the blade under hot running water between each slice. Top with spoonfuls of the sauced fruit, if using, or other toppings and sauces as desired.

query: What can I use if I don't have the recommended pan? a traditional cake pan of those dimensions what should I use if I don't have a non retractive aluminium pan preferably non-locking two-piece Style? traditional cake pan what do I need to bake it in? pan Can I bake the cheesecake in a different size pan? cheesecake can be baked in any size or style of pan, but the volume of batter, bake temperatures, and times will require individual adjustments which have not been tested here. what needs to sit flat? pan What should I do with the foil if someone is using a two-piece pan? wrap the bottom piece in foil before assembly, then tear away the excess so the pan sits flat what is the ideal pan to use? a two-piece pan What if I am using a traditional cake pan instead? line the bottom with a parchment round what is the alternative? traditional cake pan Should I grease the pan? lightly grease the pan how should I mix the ingredients? fork what do I use for the crust? graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and salt How do I combine the ingredients for the Graham Cracker Crust in this step? Add the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and salt to the pan, and stir with a fork until well combined. where should I add the salt? pan How do I get the crust to form at the bottom of the pan? With your fingers, compress into an even layer along the bottom of the pan. what other ingredient do I need besides cream cheese goat cheese lemon juice vanilla extract and salt? orange flower water what else what else should I add other than cream cheese goat cheese lemon juice vanilla extract and water? salt, and orange flower water Ok. I have done that. What is next? Do not add the sugar at this time. what method should I use to ensure there are no lumps of cheese? cream What is the first thing I should do in this step? Reduce speed to medium-low, add the sugar all at once, and mix only until well combined. what should I remove from the mixer? bowl what ingredients should I add next? eggs how should I mix the eggs? whisk How should I handle any clots of chalazae that remain trapped in the strainer? Discard any clots of chalazae that remain trapped in the strainer. where should I boil the cream? stainless steel pot what should I boil? cream What should I do after bringing the cream to a full boil? While mixing on low, add the hot cream all at once in a steady stream, and mix a few seconds more. what should be added to the mixture next? hot cream What do I do with the batter if I'm not using it immediately? Refrigerate the batter in an airtight container until needed, up to one week. Ok. what's next? Bring cold batter to room temperature before baking. What should I do after pouring batter into the pan? Place it on a baking sheet. what should I bounce on the surface to dislodge any air bubbles? spoon What strategy is suggested to remove air bubbles from the batter? Bounce a spoon across the surface to dislodge any air bubbles that may have slipped through. what temperature in fahrenheit do I need to bake it at? 250°f What is the alternate baking method mentioned for a denser, paler cheesecake? Skip to the next step and bake only at 250°F until done; this may take an hour or more. how long should I leave the oven door ajar? 10 minutes What is the next step after turning off the oven and leaving the door ajar for 10 minutes? Close the door and set the oven to 250°F. Continue baking until the outer edge of the cheesecake feels firm, though the innermost ring of cheesecake will wobble quite freely if you shake the pan, about 35 minutes. how long should I continue baking? about 35 minutes How can I tell when the cheesecake is done baking? The cheesecake will be done when the very center registers 145°F on a digital thermometer inserted to a depth of 2-inches. What causes the cheesecake to crack? Cracking is the result of over-baking and nothing more. what should I use to loosen the sides? thin knife What's the next step after letting the cheesecake cool for 15 minutes? Run a thin knife or offset spatula around the sides to loosen (this helps the cake settle evenly as it cools). After cooling the cheesecake, I've to let it settle evenly. What's the correct technique to do this? Run a thin knife or offset spatula around the sides to loosen (this helps the cake settle evenly as it cools). how long should I leave it cool at room temperature? 1 hour how long should I refrigerate? 12 hours How do I separate the cheesecake from a loose bottom cake pan? Loosen the sides of the cheesecake from the pan with a thin knife or offset spatula. Place the pan on a large can of tomatoes or a similarly sized object; something tall enough to lift the cheesecake 4-inches from the counter, and wide enough to form a stable base. With both hands on the sides of the pan, pull downward to drop the outer ring away from the bottom. Place the cake onto a flat work surface, loosen it from the bottom of the pan with an offset spatula, and transfer to a large, flat serving plate. what should I use to loosen the cheesecake? thin knife what kind of can should I use to stand it on? tomatoes how long will it stay fresh in the fridge? 10 days How do I properly remove the cheesecake from a traditional cake pan? Combine the fresh fruit and warmed fruit syrup or jam in a large bowl, and gently fold with a flexible spatula until the fruit is well coated and glistening (optional). Cut the cheesecake with a large chef's knife dipped in hot water; for clean and tidy portions of cheesecake, pause to clean the blade under hot running water between each slice. Top with spoonfuls of the sauced fruit, if using, or other toppings and sauces as desired. What should be done to ensure neat slices of cheesecake?
